text: Under the hood, we have a “default” breakpoint and whatever you define in this array. The “default” breakpoint is simply styles with no media query (and is the normal mode when in the editor). You could add an object like `{ "name": "default" }` to this `responsive_breakpoints` array as well, and change the order in which we spit out the styles onto the page. The normal behavior is default (no media query) --> any breakpoints defined in this config, but if you define the default breakpoint in your config, we’ll respect the positioning when it comes to generating css.
<@U021H3TV338> I just pushed what I hope is a fix for this, mind trying it out again and letting me know if things seem to work better for you now?
